page.title: 18TRANSPORT in Blindcrake
page.content: Blindcrake is situated on a cut-off oxbow on the main ex Roman road from Carlisle to Papcastle (near Cocker- mouth). Transport of one kind or another is almost essential if other areas are to be visited as earlier in the year the four times a day, six days a week bus service was cut to two a day on Mondays and Fridays only (Cockermouth market day is Monday). Most villagers own a car, others use bicycles, mopeds, motorbikes, vans and tractors to get to work. Apart from the main Carlisle- Cockermouth road all other roads are minor, usually only 10 feet wide. Most traffic is local and is often held up by animals being transferred from one field to another or to the farm to be milked.
